required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Three Side Hole Infusion Catheter on CT Image Quality Compared to a Standard Infusion Catheter
clinical_study.official_title: IV Contrast Administration: Effect of Three Side Hole Infusion Catheter on CT Image Quality, Infusion Pressure, and Infusion Rates, Compared to a Standard Infusion Catheter

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to compare two types of catheters used for infusing the contrast dye necessary for viewing internal organs during computed tomography (CT) scanning. The standard catheter, which has one hole from which contrast dye enters veins, will be compared to the Becton Dickinson Nexiva Diffusics System catheter, which has three holes for diffusing dye into veins. The purpose of this study is to determine which catheter type gives the best image.

primary_outcome.measure: Image quality as assessed by ratio of tissue density of liver to the aorta
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of CT scanning
primary_outcome.description: The ratio of tissue density measured in the liver to tissue density in the aorta on the CT images will be determined and will provide a measure of biodistribution, which is an important indicator of image quality. Dividing each Hounsfield unit measurement by the aorta density and determining these ratios will be done on a per patient basis to assess biodistribution as a measure of image quality.

primary_outcome.measure: Image quality as assessed by ratio of tissue density of spleen to the aorta
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of CT scanning
primary_outcome.description: The ratio of tissue density measured in the spleen to tissue density in the aorta on the CT images will be determined and will provide a measure of biodistribution, which is an important indicator of image quality. Dividing each Hounsfield unit measurement by the aorta density and determining these ratios will be done on a per patient basis to assess biodistribution as a measure of image quality.

primary_outcome.measure: Image quality as assessed by ratio of tissue density of inferior vena cava (IVC) to the aorta
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of CT scanning
primary_outcome.description: The ratio of tissue density measured in the IVC to tissue density in the aorta on the CT images will be determined and will provide a measure of biodistribution, which is an important indicator of image quality. Dividing each Hounsfield unit measurement by the aorta density and determining these ratios will be done on a per patient basis to assess biodistribution as a measure of image quality.

primary_outcome.measure: Image quality as assessed by rating scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of CT scanning
primary_outcome.description: Radiologists blinded to catheter type will review images and rate them on a scale of 1 to 10.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of CT scanning
secondary_outcome.description: The injection pressure is recorded in the electronic health record (EHR) during every CT examination preformed at the hospitals taking part in this study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of CT scanning
secondary_outcome.description: The injection flow rate is recorded in the electronic health record (EHR) during every CT examination preformed at the hospitals taking part in this study.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Becton Dickinson Nexiva Diffusics System catheter
arm_group.description: Becton Dickinson (BD Nexiva™ Diffusics™ System ) uses three laser-cut tear-drop holes located in the catheter tip to stabilize the catheter tip by reducing flow velocities while maintaining flow rates during intravenous contrast administration into the vein.
The standard catheter has one hole at the tip for contrast infusion.

intervention.intervention_name: Becton Dickinson Nexiva Diffusics System catheter
intervention.description: Becton Dickinson (BD Nexiva™ Diffusics™ System ) uses three laser-cut tear-drop holes located in the catheter tip to stabilize the catheter tip by reducing flow velocities while maintaining flow rates during intravenous contrast administration into the vein.
intervention.arm_group_label: Becton Dickinson Nexiva Diffusics System catheter

intervention.description: The standard catheter has one hole at the tip for contrast infusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing contrast enhanced CT abdomen pelvis examinations at Memorial Hermann Hospital or Lyndon B. Johnson General Hospital in Texas
- Patients whose access point is the antecubital fossa
- Patients receiving 20 or 22 gauge catheters for their CT exam
- Patients scanned on 28 or 64 slice CT machines at either hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients whose access point is other than antecubital fossa
